title: JMF R Utility Functions
text: Install latest release GitHub: install development version:

title: JMF R Utility Functions
code: x <- c(   "a", "vector", "of", "strings",   "and", "some", "letters", ":", NA,   "a", "b", "c", "and", "A", "B", "C" )  x |> uniques() #>  [1] ":"       "A"       "B"       "C"       "a"       "and"     "b"       #>  [8] "c"       "letters" "of"      "some"    "strings" "vector"  NA

title: JMF R Utility Functions
code: starwars |>   select(name, birth_year, hair_color) |>   filter(a(birth_year) & na(hair_color)) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   name                  birth_year hair_color #>   <chr>                      <dbl> <chr>      #> 1 C-3PO                        112 <NA>       #> 2 R2-D2                         33 <NA>       #> 3 Greedo                        44 <NA>       #> 4 Jabba Desilijic Tiure        600 <NA>

title: Shortcuts for is.na() — a
code: a(c(1, NA, 3)) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE  TRUE na(c(1, NA, 3)) #> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE

title: Decreases tidyverse verbosity — quiet
text: Disables: tidyverse startup messages readr column specification messages

title: Decreases tidyverse verbosity — quiet
code: quiet() library(tidyverse) # so quiet :) x <- read_csv(readr_example("mtcars.csv")) # so quiet :)

title: jmf 0.2.1
text: uniques() now keeps NAs always uses LC_COLLATE=C.
